title: Soquel Vineyards 2014 Partner's Reserve Nelson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: An intense and remarkable sense of sea salt caramel shows strongly on the nose of this bottling, bolstered by lemon rind. The palate shows much of the same, with light caramel, lemon pith and a chalky limestone character. These elements are straightforward and accessible, but make for a complete wine.

title: Paolo Manzone 2011  Barolo
description: Aromas of rose, red berry, spice and a balsamic note unfold in the glass. The rather straightforward but enjoyable palate offers mature black cherry, grilled herb and clove alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2021.

title: Paolo Scavino 2013 Nebbiolo (Langhe)
description: This vibrant expression of Nebbiolo boasts aromas of raspberry, violet and a hint of orange peel. The fresh, juicy palate doles out red cherry and white pepper while lithe tannins provide elegant support. Even though this can age for a few more years, enjoy it soon for maximum freshness.

title: Rôtie Cellars 2013 Homage Red (Washington)
description: Mourvèdre makes up three-quarters of this blend, with the balance Syrah and Grenache. Garrigue, spice and raspberry aromas lead to rich, focused plum flavors that put a premium on purity. Smoked meat and savory flavors intertwine on the finish.

title: Raphael 2013 First Label Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Like many of Raphael's red wines, there's a deeply savory, leathery rusticity here that resonates powerfully. Ripe black cherry and plum flavors are cut by streaks of tart currant and cranberry acidity and a rigid frame of tannins. It's a bold, densely structured wine that should improve with cellaring. Drink from 2020 through 2025.

title: Raphael 2013 Reserve Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)
description: There's an intently Old World feel to this powerful Malbec that is bolstered by shades of leather and barnyard, char and dark toast. The palate is rich, almost ruddy, with black plum and cherry flavors, but balanced by zesty acidity. Coarse, mouth dampening tannins mark the finish now, but should meld nicely from 2020 through 2023.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Mas Thérèse Rosé (Bandol)
description: The Gantelme family has run this vineyard since 1908. In this vintage, the blend allows room for the structure of the Mourvèdre along with the ripe accessible fruits of Grenache and Cinsault. It is a rich wine, full of red-berry flavors and with a food-friendly structure. Drink from the end of 2016.

title: Shutter 2013 Barrel Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an inaugural release from photographer Kurt-Inge Eklund with the assistance of winemakers Denis and May-Britt Malbec. Made from grapes grown on the hillsides of Howell Mountain, including 12% Merlot, it pleases in leather, tar and cassis-cranberry, the tannins sizable yet polished. Oak is impressively French, 80% of it new.

title: Longboard 2014 Mystos Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Luscious red fruit accompanies a succulent, sleek and well-built medium body here, the wine well-integrated in terms of tannin, oak and power. Soft, it finishes in a flurry of finesse and lingering lengths of black tea and strawberry.

title: Nals Margreid 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Delicate aromas that recall spring wild flower, orchard fruit, herb and crushed rock lead the nose on this structured white. Aged partly in large casks, the round, full-bodied palate offers ripe pear, nectarine and a flinty mineral note while fresh acidity provides balance.

title: Nastl 2015 Strinmassl Riesling (Kamptal)
description: Ardent notions of Meyer lemon and Valencia orange are in the process of freeing themselves from the yeasty youthfulness of this bottling. Ripe citrus is expressed with grace and aptness here: all the freshness, all the zestiness, couched in perfect aromatic poise, fully ripe but without an ounce of flab.

title: Vie Winery 2012 Les Amours Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of Syrah from Thompson and White Hawk vineyards, as well as a touch of Mourvèdre from Alta Mesa, shows lively anise and dill herbs on the nose, along with black strawberries, dense blackberries, damp sage, violet and tar. The oregano-thyme-bay leaf herbal side of the sip is strong, giving nuance to the elderberry and blueberry fruit.

title: Seven Oxen 2013 Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Lavish black cherries, plump blackberries and ripe blueberries mesh into a dense floral bouquet with a dried mint accent on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Grenache. Dark but zesty fruits of black raspberry and woody elderberry start the sip, settling into cranberry, black pepper and dried beef in the midpalate. The tannins are simultaneously soft and ever-present.

title: Occasio 2014 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a brawny wine, but a complete and delicious one, because all the separate, dramatic components balance each other nicely. Butter and vanilla oozes from the aroma, ripe apple and delicious pear pour from the flavors, and vibrant acidity balances the almost unctuous texture.

title: Órale 2011 Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A small project by Carr Winery cellarmaster Chris Wright, this 50-50 blend of Grenache and Syrah is vivacious on the nose with bright pomegranate, nearly effervescent black cherry, iced coffee and inviting fruit punch aromas. There's a sliver of tar to the sip, but mostly suave black and red plum fruit, exotic bergamot tang and Chinese five spice complexity.

title: Wohlmuth 2015 Kitzecker Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
description: The faintest notes of sea-breeze conjure up lemony freshness on the nose of this spritzy, light-bodied and fragrant wine. The aromatic allure of citrus foliage and lime zest unfolds beautifully on the creamy, balanced palate and makes for grown-up fun.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A variety of top sites are blended together for this wine, including Seven Hills, Bacchus, Dionysus, Klipsun and Pepper Bridge. It offers bright aromas of raspberries and chocolate, with herb and floral accents. The palate is flavorful and full, delivering a lot of enjoyment, with the tannins adding some heft.

title: Freemark Abbey 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Aged in stainless steel and small barrels of French oak, this wine remains smooth and silky with interweaved acidity, a classic, fresh expression of the variety with very subtle oak. Vanilla and pear find their way onto the finish, providing additional layers of flavor and finesse.

title: Gassier 2015 Le Pas du Moine Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: This wine has an herbal aroma and a crisp palate that delivers tropical fruits cut by grapefruit. The wine comes from the privileged Mont Saint-Victoire vineyards, named after the path that runs along the south side of the mountain. It has a distinctly mineral texture and perfumed acidity. At the end, the wine is bright, tight and crisp.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2013 Instinctual Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A plush style of the grape, this shows blackberry and black plum fruit, lush purple flowers, baking spice and a dusting of graphite on the nose. The palate is soft and cola-driven, with blackberry puree, woody elderberry and violet flavors. The tannic structure enhance its robust character.

title: Iby 2015 Rosé (Burgenland)
description: Shimmering with the palest salmon pink, this is a softly scented, restrained but very refreshing rosé. Absolutely dry, it majors on fresh lemon notes with tart inflections of red currant. The slightest fizz helps the freshness even more. Lovely.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Summation Red (California)
description: A big, bold wine that also tastes precise and structured, it has deep, dense fruit flavors like black currant and black cherry, layers of fine tannins, hints of dark chocolate and espresso. This is a great wine to stash in the cellar, as it will taste best after 2020.

title: Unger 2015 Zieselrain Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Softly scented notes of ripe, yellow pears play on the nose. On the palate they become lusciously mouth-filling with their unobtrusive, friendly softness. There is a backbone of freshness and wonderful depth of lemon, with pear-scented concentration.

title: Clos Henri 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: For a winemaking family from the Loire, it must be a delight to work in Marlborough's almost unfailing sunshine. This is a medium-bodied, silky Pinot with scents of compost. Add that gentle earthiness to black cherry fruit, hints of herb and cola and the result is a winning combination. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Clos Solène 2015 La Rosa Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Simultaneously light, vivacious and flavor-packed, this bottling is a lightly faded shade of pink in the glass, and shows delicate bubble gum, sliced watermelon, pink rose buds and a squeeze of lime on the nose. The blend of 45% Grenache, 30% Mourvèdre and 25% Syrah offers zesty acidity and a pithy texture on the palate, with bright tangerine, lemon pith and a touch of strawberry fruit.

title: Domaine de la Bégude 2015 White (Bandol)
description: With a dominance of Clairette in the blend, this wine has a rich, lightly salty character as well as juicy green-plum flavors. It comes from organically grown grapes in one of the small parcels that make up the vineyard. Ripe and fruity with just a tang in the air, it is ready to drink.

title: Château Miraval 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The product of a partnership between Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie with the Perrin family of Château Beaucastel in Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this bottling achieves instant fame. Happily, it is also a very fine wine, perfectly balanced between crisp fruit and acidity. In the background a touch of tannin accompanies pepper and minerality. It is ready to drink.

title: Alma Rosa 2014 El Jabali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very tight and Chablis-like in style, this bottling from Richard and Thekla Sanford shows crisp Asian pear, lemon pith, Pink Lady apple rinds, wet concrete and a touch of petrol on the nose. The palate is light and fresh, with yellow pear, nectarine and a lemon skin-led acidity, possessing all the bones to age with style.

title: Boekenoogen 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The nose on this bottling shows just enough of everything to please all sorts of Chardonnay fans: yellow apple flesh, sea salt, a touch of butter and jasmine-laced honeydew aromas. The palate starts soft and then slowly sizzles with acidity, presenting flavors of butter, lemon rinds and key lime. It's a down-the-middle wine.

title: ONX 2013 Brash Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: This blending house adds 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Malbec to boost this Zinfandel-based wine, which shows baked strawberries, blackberry puree, beef char and smoke on the nose. The fruit is tart and black on the palate, with mint and anise notes.
